item.title: Set up an Electron Project with VUE
item.description: Download Resources Node.js Node.js download using node -v npm -v to check. Vue initial Vue by using the command: npm install -g @vue/cli # OR yarn global add @vue/cli using vue --version to check Create a new Vue project create vue create [vue-electorn-demo-name] run the project npm run serve Add electron Using vue-cli-plugin-electron-builder vue add electron-builder Run Project in Electron npm run eletron:serve the project will look like:

item.title: Hugo Common Commands
item.description: Create create a new site hugo new site [siteName] Add Blogs create a new blog hugo new [path/blogName.md] the new blog will locate in the siteName/content/path, and default with a header Build open the site in local hugo serve view the draft hugo -D serve view the draft with a theme hugo -D serve --theme=[themeName] view with a base URL

item.title: No Response After Executing `vue iu`
item.description: Problems When I was learning VUE, and I want to create a new VUE project after install VUE and npm. However, when I type in vue uithen enter, it shows noting. Solution using a command cnpm i -g @vue/cli , run it, then execute vue uiagain, then it works.

item.title: Add Tags for Hugo Articles
item.description: config.toml add below statements into config.toml file tag = "tags" category = "categories" Blog add tags into the header of the md file for example, in this article, the header is: title: "Add Tags for Hugo Articles" date: 2021-10-27T10:25:39+08:00 draft: true tags: ["hugo"]

item.title: Hugo create the public folder but it have not rendered
item.description: Issue When I want to put my public folder to a LAN, the HTML and hyperlinks are showed, but the subpages and the CSS (the theme) did not appear. This web can work well with the git page and the localhost. Solution First, I commented on the baseURL in the config.toml, but it cannot work Final add baseUrl = "//example.org" relativeURLs = true uglyURLs = true into the config.
